newsitem.title: USA: Cadence signs deal with Fujitsu unit.
newsitem.headline: Cadence signs deal with Fujitsu unit.

text.p: Cadence Design Systems Inc said Friday it signed a long-term outsourcing deal with International Computers Ltd, a subsidiary of Japan's Fujitsu Ltd that is based in Manchester, England.
Cadence, a San Jose, Calif.,-based computer software company, said the contract will begin May 1. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.
Under the deal, Cadence will be provide integrated circuit design services to International Computer to support its next-generation multi-processor mainframe computers.

A design team from International Computer will be moved to Cadence's design center in Manchester to maintain the center. Members of the team will become full-time Cadence personnel and complement Cadence's European design factory network.
Cadence, which has more than 3,500 employees and had 1996 annual sales of $742 million, has sales offices and research facilities around the world.
